name: Surf & Sand Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: This is a lovely property (although not quite as lovely as their rack rate might suggest), but it has a major deal-breaker: NO AIR CONDITIONING!!!
reviews.title: A really hot hotel -- and not in a good way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Perhaps the climate here at night is usually mild and the rooms cool off from the ocean breeze, but this week it's very hot out (90's) and there's no wind. My room is sweltering. Even if it weren't brutally hot out, I can't imagine that anyone would want to sleep with the balcony door open because the ocean is very loud -- so loud that the hotel provides earplugs on every nightstand.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views, Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: There's really no excuse for a hotel in North America in 2007 not to have air conditioning -- and not to advise their potential guests in advance of this fact.
reviews.title: Can not imagine staying anywhere else

likes.liked: — proximity to ocean, views, sound of surf,cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very well maintained (although the elevators seem to keep breaking down) and has an unmatched setting on the side of a small cliff overlooking the ocean. The ocean is so close that the waves crash up against the hotel at high tide; the beach is quite narrow this year, and there don't appear to be any beach chairs or other hotel services on the beach.
reviews.title: Very friendly and helpful service!! Wouldn't stay anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nicely appointed. The staff are friendly and doting. The guests this week are mostly families with rambunctious children, and business people attending meetings in the many on-site meeting rooms. The gym is very small but adequate -- although it's too hot for a good workout, and two of the seven cardio machines are currently out of order.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
What a find & wow!
reviews.text: A small group of us stayed at the S&S two weekends ago and the experience was amazing. Looking at other review people's expectations seemed a little off with the no ac conversation but this is nothing to the overall five star experinece we received from the staff. The resort is on the ocean, the pool, bars and resturant are on the ocean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We wake and go for a swim, have lunch or a drink in the bar and go for a swim. Actually, I swam and ate my lunch thru the windows with my traveling companions. All six of us loved the rooms, the beds are so sampling, the ocean at night and by the way ac is going in next year. The morning coffe shop was great as breakfast which was one of the best. We often stay at other resorts around this part of the coast but this wins on all counts. It is expensive as in over $600 a night but worth every penny.
reviews.title: Relaxation found!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is excellent and we did use our car once. We walked to bars, restaurants and stores. Overall a triple A experience. S&S keep up the amazing work you gem of a resort.
reviews.title: THE VIEWS!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our visit to the Surf and Sand was wonderful. The rooms were beautifully appointed and my daughter loved the "floating" beds! The lights under them make them look they are floating in air. We loved sleeping with the windows open to hear the surf. As a Southern Californian I love the heat, so I did not mind the no a/c. We just hung at the pool and dipped our feet in the surf. The beach is clean and the pool side service was superb. The pool was closed early in the evening to prepare for a private party, but we did not mind as we spent the whole day at the pool. Spashes restaurant offered excellent service and food, and it was a great place to watch the sunset. Our stay was short, but I would certainly stay again. Even though we just came up from our own resort town of San Diego, it felt like we were on a far away vacation being right on the beach.
reviews.title: Seriously, no air conditioning?!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Honestly, the view from the rooms is awe inspiring. I was so mesmerized by it, I find it difficult to write anything else about the room in general. Yes, there is no AC. I was able to keep the room temp very manageable and I like my rooms pretty chilly by other peoples standards. I did sleep with the windows open (shutters closed) and I slept VERY well. If you are sensitive to sound - yes, you will hear the waves crashing. I found it soothing. In the morning you can sit on your balcony and enjoy coffee and then maybe take a walk on the beach. Just beautiful ...SUCH a lovely experience! Okay- and beyond the ocean views, the location is great - we would walk downtown for dinner. If you are staying in laguna, the two things you want to consider are beach access (ideal to have a hotel situated directly on the ocean) and the ability to walk to the downtown restaurants. The surf and sand has both. Oh, and did I mention the view?
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel with ocean liner views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend invited me to join her on a "girlfriend getaway" to the Surf and Sand Resort in Laguna Beach. The hotel rooms were incredibly spacious and clean and the view from the balcony was to die for. The ocean was literally steps away. The balcony provided the perfect setting for sun bathing, reading, or sipping a glass of wine at sunset. Surf and Sand is walking distance from downtown, so you really don't need to drive around. Also, the food at Splashes is absolutely delicious. My friend actually won the stay as a gift, so all we had to pay for were our meals and drinks. Though the rooms are pricey, after staying here, I can say it's worth it and I would definitely come back. My only negative is that the proximity of the rooms to the ocean can make it difficult to sleep soundly at night due to the sound of crashing waves. (The actual waves on the Pacific ocean are waaayyyy louder than the sound of waves on a soundscapes CD.) Thankfully, the hotel provides ear plugs in each rooom, just in case. I can't wait to go back and I'd highly reccommend it for a couples getaway, as it has a pretty romantic vibe.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel on the beach

likes.liked: — The Aveda facial products in the rooms.
likes.disliked: — There's only two elevators and they can take forever to reach you.

reviews.title: From the ocean crashing to the sun sparkling on the water.......Sublime.
reviews.text: Loved everything about the place...........

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!
reviews.text: The room was wonderful. Spotless, comfortable, well appointed. The turn down service made me smile at the end of a fun evening!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ocean delivered sensory delights every day.
reviews.title: A Surf and Sand Convert!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar was fun. The restaurant was good. Work out room well equiped.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel with gorgeous views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here with the family for 10 nights over christmas and new year. 2nd floor tower block. Woke up most mornings to see dolphins and whales swim past the room. Didnt even have to leave the bed!
reviews.title: View dolphins and whales from your bed

likes.disliked: — Had to pay to access internet in the room. Free to use in the coffee shop though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was excellent. Was provided with a christmas tree. Also kids given choice of presents. Received a bottle of wine and christmas cake on christmas eve.
reviews.title: Awesome getaway from LA

likes.liked: — The view from the room, restaurant, bar....
likes.disliked: — there was nothing not to love about this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Were given a bottle of champagne on new years eve.
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding Night!

likes.liked: — The views from the balcony and the staff.
likes.disliked: — Room service was a bit pricey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff were really friendly.
reviews.title: Gotta Love Upgrades!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Their website images of the hotel dont do it justice.
reviews.title: One of my favorites

likes.disliked: — It does cost some money - but so worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're up for a splurge, invest it in an ocean front room. Stepping out on the balcony makes you feel like your steps away from the water. Also, I love being able to hear the lull of the ocean crashing when falling asleep.
reviews.title: Great hotel with gorgeous views!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: As for desserts, wasn't very impressed.
reviews.title: could be great but....NO A/C for $400 + per night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Overall, this places earns four stars for location!
reviews.title: Magical Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is disappointing more because it's so close to being a 5 star
reviews.title: The view can't get any better...other things can

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: hotel and given it's location it should be but for some reason someone in management
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just went here for our 10 year anniversary. Unbelieveable place with exceptional service and views. If you're willing to spend the money you will not be disappointed. You are in walking distance of everything in Laguna including shopping, food and activities. Splashes restaurant has exceptional food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The only negative I have for the resort is that the bar area is small. Even though it's literally on the beach, it can get crowded on the weekends. Other than that, it's a fantastic place.
reviews.title: Awesome Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Wanted to surprise my ailing mother with a seaside celebration of her 76th birthday. Andrew in reservations saw to it that we were accommodated with a very nice ADA equipped suite on the Tower side of the property. Thank you, Andrew!
reviews.title: Lovely Seaside Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our beautiful seaside room was perfect. Stunning views of the ocean and soothing waves have left her with a treasured memory.
reviews.title: Great Romantic Getaway -- Surfside Rooms are the BEST!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: A note of thanks to fitness instructor, Tommy Bensen who so graciously held his Boot camp workout dispite the fact that I was the sole boot camper, inspirational!!
reviews.title: Still lovely, but needs some tweaking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was so incredible in regard to my mother's limited ability to leave her suite. Did not get the name of the man and woman that attended to her the afternoon of September 1, but thank you!
reviews.title: Palace of dreams
Romantic Setting, but OverPriced (Nickled and Dimed)
reviews.text: Great OceanFront Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is the Rack Rate and Parking Rate and Spashes Food Prices!
reviews.title: It was perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I never write reviews but after reading some of the negative reviews, I felt compelled. A friend of mine described this hotel as "dreamy" and I agree! The service was prompt and superbly friendly. When requested, our room was upgraded on arrival and arrangements were made to get us checked into the room early. This was a bonus but I imagine in the high season this is more rare. The hotel is an open-air complex but I would consider it VERY far from a motel. It is a large hotel with a small intimate feel. It is ocean front with very easy access to the beach. This is not the case at all hotels in Laguna given the bluff landscape of the area. You received champagne on arrival and turn-down service each night. It is pricey but worth it -- especially if you are looking for some beach time. I booked it on Skoosh.com, which I had never heard of before but they were great and I found the best price there. Overall, a really fabulous experience. I would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice but not worth it..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on our honeymoon. Valet and front desk were unfriendly. Front desk took credit card info I was thinking for anything we wanted to charge to room... ended up they charged my entire stay 'again' and it had been prepaid at the time vacation was booked. Didn't know that until I tried to use cc for outside purchases. Yes, it was a new credit card with a small credit limit only for use on our honeymoon... that ended up tying up our credit for the enitre time of our stay... and hours with credit card company on the phone to see why we couldn't use it... Anyway it's a beautiful location.. hotel is older and resturant isn't all that.. def go outside hotel for dining... We stayed in the smaller building which was nice and just about on the sand... Laguna is a beautiful place but if I was to visit again I'd stay somewhere else....
reviews.title: Glorified Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, this hotel was a big disappointment. It really looks and feels like a motel that they have tried to renovate over the years. It is RIGHT on the beach, so if that is what you are looking for, then it might be the place for you. Otherwise for the price, it is a major disappointment. The room was ocean facing with a balcony, but the it was very small and the bathroom was tiny. Not the place if you are looking for something luxurious.
reviews.title: Amazing Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I first stayed at this amazing resort after a rather unpleasant weekend in Las Vegas. The trip to Vegas was so negative that I didn't want to return home with that negativity. So, by pure luck I searched local resorts and found Surf and Sand resort. It was late evening, during peak season when I called. I spoke to Emil at the front desk. He was very professional, helpful, and made me feel more welcome than any resort I have ever experienced. I HIGHLY recommend asking for Emil if you want that "special guest" feel. I have spoke to other front desk personnel and the service and feel was just "typical" check-in experience Not bad, but nothing like my experience with Emil. Also, I cant say enough about the bell desk and Valet service. Those guys are so accommodating I feel like a celebrity every time you drive up. I have gone back to Surf and Sand 5 different times in the last 3 weeks. I stayed 4 days the first time, went home for one night and had to go back the next day for another 3 days. Went home for 3 days and just couldn't stay away so I went back for another night. I did this over and over 5 times.... I might go back tonight. I LOVE this place. I'm sure you will too if you meet the same crew I did.
reviews.title: I can't get enough Surf and Sand resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OH, and the rooms in building 2 are all amazing... The sound of the waves crashing 24/7 is unbelievable. I will never go to Vegas for relaxation again. I will see you there again.... SOON.
reviews.title: Rooms are uninhabitable. Nice place if you don't have to stay in a room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Mike I.
reviews.title: Perfection at Surf and Sand!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Dana Point CA
reviews.title: Daughter's wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location & beach. Good & tasty food in restaurant. High prices are justified because of the views & open air. The rooms are nicely furnished, but are uninhabitable. There is no air circulation in the rooms which is especially bad because there is no air conditioning. If you are on the ocean side, the waves are so noisy, that you cannot sleep. If your room is facing PCH, the traffic noise is unbearable. You can't close the sliding glass door unless you don't mind suffocating. The bathroom had no exhaust fan or window for air (A violation of current codes)
reviews.title: Best place in Laguna Beach

aka: The Surf And Sand Hotel Laguna Beach
description: For 60 years this incomparable setting on the Laguna Beach coastline has been sought out by people looking for the perfect getaway. The resort has flourished over time, but the reason people visit us has remained the same.
